results.title: Superman and the bride
results.brief_description: Sets out to take a hard look at the main messages that come to us daily from the media, focusing on images of men and women. Does the mass media give us an accurate picture of the sexes or do they serve up a stereotype diet of sexy, passive females and tough, dynamic males? This atempts to answer these questions using satire, songs, cartoons and clips from film. Cast includes Julie Covington, Jane Meadows, Charlie Stafford. Narrated by Gavin Richards, Stephanie Turner.

results.title: Supermab
results.brief_description: A mathematics program which uses a humorous approach to revise place value concepts, substraction with regrouping and substraction with a zero difficulty. No other credits available.

results.title: Superb lyrebird
results.brief_description: This synchronised picture and sound record of the territorial calls and display of the lyrebird was produced to help the Division of Wildlife Research to correlate the bird’s throat and beak movements with the sound produced.

results.title: Super 8 soldiers
results.creator_credit: Mark Worth, Australia. Special Broadcasting Service and Kino Eye Pictures
results.brief_description: This unusual video explores the day-to-day life of Australian soldiers who served during the Vietnamese War. By using super-8 film footage that the soldiers took of themselves, we are taken from training in Australia to the camps in Vietnam where the young men were to confront the terrors of fighting a bitter guerrila war. The super-8 images are ultimately touching because they reveal young boys at the point of losing their innocence. The haunting musical score is by David Bridie and John Phillips of Not Drowning, Waving.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Mark Worth, Australia. Special Broadcasting Service and Kino Eye Pictures

results.title: Sunshine romance
results.brief_description: This short romantic docudrama was made in the year after World War II and begins by showing troops returning home and what “freedom” means to them and the women waiting for them after the horrors of war. A nationalistic film, with commentary about the future Bill and his girl Sue had planned before Bill was called off to war - symbolic of a nation with a great future. Set in the scenic beauty of the Blue Mountains and the colorful hustle bustle of Sydney. Featuring John Temple and Coralie Kelly as the lovers, and commentary by Robert Pollard.

results.title: Sunshine man : Changes face of farming
results.brief_description: Examines the development of the Sunshine Harvester by Hugh McKay, and the landmark industrial relations conflict in which he subsequently became involved, leading to the first Basic Wage ruling (1907).

results.title: Sunrise, Sunset: Moni and George
results.creator_credit: Chris O'Rourke and Healthsharing Women. Publishing and Production Group
results.brief_description: Some of the changes occurring in Australia in Australian industry. are examined in this programme. The episode looks at what has been the success of such changes. Moni, a bank employee, and George, an airport services co-ordinator, give their points of view.
